column1: font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif
Follow these steps carefully to ensure smooth processing of your Schengen visa application:
• All documents must be printed on A4 size sheets only.
• All applicants must book an appointment online to submit their visa application and biometric data at the Schengen visa application centre.
• Required documents must be submitted with the visa application (no fax or email to Embassy accepted).
• Only documents listed in the checklist will be accepted.
• If your visa has been refused previously, you must submit the refusal notice or a written explanation of the reason for travel and refusal.
• TTK will review your documents and suggest necessary changes before submission.
• TTK will book an appointment as per jurisdiction at the Visa Application Centre (VAC), subject to slot availability. Inform TTK of your tentative dates at the earliest.
• Applicants must visit the VAC in person to provide biometric fingerprint data with a signed application form, appointment letter, and checklist documents.
• Alternatively, TTK can submit the application if the applicant qualifies for biometric waiver due to previous Schengen visa issuance.
• Courier service is available by filling out the 'Courier Request Form'. The passport will be sent to the address mentioned in the form.
• Standard processing time: 10 to 15 business days from the date of application at the VFS Application Centre.
• Processing duration may vary. Final decision is at the discretion of the Embassy/Consulate.
• Consular officers may request additional documents or a personal interview if required.

Disclaimer: TTK Services Private Limited (""TTK"") will facilitate services in compliance with the respective foreign mission's requirements. TTK is not involved in the adjudication of visa applications or decisions related to approval/refusal. TTK shall not be held responsible for delays, restricted visa entries, or further documentation/interview requests made by the consular authority.

• All documents must be printed on A4 size sheets only.

display_field,instruction_display,,,display_field,,False,<!DOCTYPE html>
Let’s Make Your Visa Process Easy!
Welcome to your Visa Application Journey!
<!-- Intro paragraph with manual line break -->
Our guided process, along with the support of a TTK Visa Consultant,
will help you complete this journey with ease.
Your filled Visa Application Form will be automatically generated in your downloadable Docket at the end of this process.
An instruction sheet in the Docket will tell you exactly what to carry, including originals, copies, and any additional documents.
Our team will continuously review your details and documents to ensure everything is in order.
A dedicated Visa Consultant will be assigned to assist and guide you at every step.
For added convenience, you can choose from a range of Add-On Services during your application journey.
All your traveller details will be submitted and saved securely.

Need help with this part? Here’s what you need to know.
To ensure your application goes smoothly, please make sure your Passport meets the following requirements:
It must be valid for at least 6 months from your date of departure from Switzerland.
Your passport should be in good condition — no water damage, torn pages, peeling lamination, or spelling errors in your name.
It should not include any official observations like ECR status, changes to place of birth, spouse’s name, surname, or address.
If you have any old passports, please include the originals (if applicable).

Need help with this part? Here’s what you need to know.
Before uploading your travel itinerary, make sure of the following:
Include Key Trip Details: Your itinerary should clearly mention your travel dates, destinations, and planned activities or stays in each city or country.
Cover All Schengen Countries: If you’re visiting multiple Schengen countries, make sure your itinerary reflects each stop, along with the dates and purpose of visit.

column2: Transport: Ensure the information in your itinerary matches your hotel bookings, flight tickets, or train/bus reservations.
Clear: You can submit a day-by-day plan in a simple tabular format on Excel, Word or as a PDF. Just make sure it’s easy to follow.

column1: Don’t have an itinerary? We can help create one for you as part of our Add-On Services.

Need help with this part? Here’s what you need to know.
Before uploading your travel itinerary, make sure of the following:
Upload hotel reservations, Airbnb confirmations, or any other proof of stay for the entire duration of your trip.
If you’re visiting multiple cities or countries, make sure you include accommodation details for each stop.
The check-in/check-out dates should align with your travel itinerary and transportation bookings.
If you're staying with friends or family, upload a signed Invitation Letter from your host, along with a copy of their ID or proof of residence.
You can upload a single file with all your accommodation details, or multiple files, whatever is easier for you.
We can help create a sample plan for you, just choose our Add-On Service.

Need help with this part? Here’s what you need to know.
You can refer to the list of approved Indian Travel Insurances:
• Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euro/50,000 USD/50,000 CHF per person
Coverage of all expenses which might arise in connection with
repatriation for medical reasons, urgent medical attention and/or
• The insurance has to cover the entire stay in Schengen territory
Applicants who wish to apply for a six-month or a one-year multiple visa
are not obliged to provide a 180 (365) days coverage. It is sufficient to
submit an insurance policy covering the first journey.
